alert.note: Alert for North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 28 at 11:30AM ADT until October 28 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life-threatening breaking waves between 12 to 18 feet, dangerous rip currents, and coastal flooding and erosion. * WHERE...Beaches of San Juan and Vicinity, North Central and Northwest. * WHEN...Coastal Flood Advisory through Saturday evening, High Surf Advisory through Sunday evening and High Risk of Rip Currents through Monday. * IMPACTS...Strong currents that can carry even the strongest swimmer out to sea. Large breaking waves, dangerous rip currents and localized beach erosion. Large breaking waves that can knock persons and animals off rocks and jetties and into the sea and cause coastal erosion. Roads impassable due to salt water intrusion.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.

area.areaDesc: North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
